00040 #ifndef _resourcemanager_h
00041 #define _resourcemanager_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 #include "managerbase.h"
00046 #include "resourceinputstream.h"
00047 
00048 #include <istream>
00049 #include <vector>
00050 
00051 class btBulletWorldImporter;
00052 
00053 namespace Ogre
00054 {
00055     class ResourceGroupManager;
00056 }
00057 
00058 namespace phys
00059 {
00060     class ActorBase;
00061     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00062     /// @class ResourceManager
00063     /// @headerfile resourcemanager.h
00064     /// @brief This is the manager responsible for the loading and unloading of files.
00065     /// @details This class is responsible for the reading and writing of files of all kinds, be
00066     /// it graphical meshes, physics data, or XMl files.
00067     ///////////////////////////////////////
00068     class PHYS_LIB ResourceManager : public ManagerBase {
00069         protected:
00070             /// @brief Encapsulates the functionality of the ogre resource group manager.
00071             Ogre::ResourceGroupManager* OgreResource;
00072 
00073             /// @brief Applies a saved shape to an Actor.
00074             void ApplyShapeToActor(ActorBase* Actor, btCollisionShape* ColShape);
00075 
00076             /// A list of Pointers to streams created to delete periodically.
00077             std::vector<ResourceInputStream*> DeleteList;
00078 
00079         public:
00080             /// @brief Class constructor.
00081             /// @details Standard manager constructor.
00082             ResourceManager();
00083             /// @details Class Destructor.
00084             ~ResourceManager();
00085 
00086             /// @brief Exports an actors shape data to a file.
00087             /// @param FileName The Filename to save the data too. Remember to include a ".bullet" extension to the filename when serializing.
00088             /// @param Actor The Actor's Shape to save
00089             bool ExportShapeData(ActorBase* Actor, const String &FileName);
00090             /// @brief Imports serialized shape data from the disk to be used in an Actor.
00091             /// @param FileName The Filename to load the data from. Remember to include a ".bullet" extension to the filename when serializing.
00092             /// @param Actor The Actor's Shape to restore from file
00093             bool ImportShapeData(ActorBase* Actor, const String &FileName);
00094 
00095             /// @brief Adds a location for graphical resources.
00096             /// @details This function will add a location on the disk to find files needed to create and
00097             /// manipulate graphical objects. Once a resource is added it must be initalized using
00098             /// ResourceManager::InitResourceGroup(String Group).
00099             /// @param Location The location on the file system the resource can be found.
00100             /// @param Type The kind of file system the location can be found in. @n
00101             /// Options are: filesystem, zip.
00102             /// @param Group The name of the group the resources at this location belong to.
00103             /// @param recursive Whether or not to search sub-directories.
00104             void AddResourceLocation(const String &Location, const String &Type, const String &Group, const bool &recursive=false);
00105             /// @brief Prepares the resource for use.
00106             /// @details This function can be thought of as a preloader.  This will prepare the defined
00107             /// resource located on the disk for use.
00108             /// @param Name Name of the file/resource to be 'prepared'.
00109             /// @param Type The type of resource that the file is. @n
00110             /// Options are: Font, GpuProgram, HighLevelGpuProgram, Material, Mesh, Skeleton, Texture.
00111             /// @param Group Name of the group the resource belongs to.
00112             void DeclareResource(const String& Name, const String& Type, const String& Group);
00113             /// @brief Makes a resource group ready to use.
00114             /// @details After adding all of your resources and declaring them as nessessary, this function
00115             /// is the final step.  After calling this function any and all resources within the defined group
00116             /// will be ready to use.  Do not initialize any more groups then you need to however, as that will
00117             /// take up memory and drop performance.
00118             /// @param Name Name of the resource group.
00119             void InitResourceGroup(const String& Name);
00120 
00121             /// @brief Get a stream to read from the specified file
00122             /// @param FileName The name of the File you want to stream data from
00123             /// @return An derivative of std::istream a ResourceInputStream that will pull it's data from the desired resource
00124             /// @details The returned ResourceInputStream is the Caller's responsibility to deal with. If it is not deleted it is a memory leak.
00125             ResourceInputStream* GetResourceStream(const String& FileName);
00126 
00127             ////Functions inherited from ManagerBase
00128             /// @brief Empty Initializor
00129             /// @details This specific initializor is unneeded, but we implement it for compatibility. It also exists
00130             /// in case a derived class wants to override it for some reason.
00131             void Initialize();
00132             /// @brief Empty MainLoopItems
00133             /// @details This class implements this for the sake of entension and compatibility this function does nothing. This is just empty during this round of refactoring,
00134             /// and this will get all the functionality that currently should be here, but is in the world.
00135             void DoMainLoopItems();
00136             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00137             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::ResourceManager
00138             ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00139     };
00140 }
00141 
00142 #endif
